alert.note: Alert for Casey (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 12:20PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Casey County through 1245 PM EDT... At 1220 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Magnum, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Casey County, including the following locations... Evona, Mintonville, Ware, Windsor, Teddy, Argyle, Phil and Labascus. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 PM EDT for central and south central Kentucky.
